CVE_data_meta.TITLE: GlobalProtect App: Missing certificate validation vulnerability can disclose pre-logon authentication cookie

description_data.value: When the pre-logon feature is enabled, a missing certification validation in Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect app can disclose the pre-logon authentication cookie to a man-in-the-middle attacker on the same local area network segment with the ability to manipulate ARP or to conduct ARP spoofing attacks. This allows the attacker to access the GlobalProtect Server as allowed by configured Security rules for the 'pre-login' user. This access may be limited compared to the network access of regular users.

work_around.value: The impact of this vulnerability can be mitigated by decreasing the allowed timeout settings for the prelogon feature or by completely disabling the feature in the GlobalProtect gateway.

solution.value: This issue is fixed in GlobalProtect app 5.0.10, GlobalProtect app 5.1.4, and all later GlobalProtect app versions.

credit.value: Palo Alto Networks thanks Tom Wyckhuys and Nabeel Ahmed from NTT Belgium for discovering and reporting this issue.
